704919f-a.text:
118-122 Hicks Street, at the N.W. corner of Clark Street. Willow Street is seen in the background. The first house on the corner was the home of Robert Hicks of the Poughkeepsie Hicks family. Later Mr. Greigen owned the three houses. They were razed in 1922.

1921.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704919f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

704921f-a.text:
123-153 Hicks Street, east side, near Clark Street. The building in the foreground, was used partially in 1823 by the Brooklyn Collegiate Institute; and in 1842 it was known as the Mansion House. It was razed in 1930.

April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704921f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

704923f-a.text:
137 Hicks Street, east side, between Clark Street and Love lane. A view of the Mansion House Hotel, Brooklyn's oldest hotel, now 120 years
old.
December 1925.
Brown Brothers.
704923f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

704922f-a.text:
124-140 Hicks Street, near the S.W. corner of Clark Street.
February 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

704920f-a.text:
Hicks Street (right), south of Clark Street, showing a general view south  from the Hotel St. George.
June 13, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

703578f-a.text:
Clark Street, at the S.W. corner of Hicks Street, showing the house in which Henry Ward Beecher passed away in 1887. It has now (1936) been razed. 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703578f-a.folder: Clark Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY

704926f-a.text:
159 Hicks Street, east side, between Clark Street and Love Lane. A view of the Stephen Brophy house. It was razed in 1890.
1888.
Eugene L. Arnbruster Collection.
